alert.note: Alert for Okanogan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 07 at 2:27PM PDT until July 08 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE CEDAR CREEK BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT SATURDAY FOR WEST CENTRAL OKANOGAN COUNTY... At 227 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to locally heavy rain over the Cedar Creek Burn Scar, mainly south and southwest of Mazama near Storey Peak and Gardner Mountain. Over half an inch of rain fell in this area in under a half hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Cedar Creek Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Cedar Creek Burn Scar. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mazama and Klipchuck Campground. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: The affected areas are in and below the Cedar Creek burn scar south of Highway 20 from Mazama to Winthrop, including the Chickadee Trailhead and Wolf Creek Road. Some drainage basins impacted include Cedar Creek, Varden Creek, Little Boulder Creek, Wolf Creek, and Thompson Creek. Moderate to high intensity rainfall on the burned area may cause flash flooding, mud slides and rock slides. Campers, hikers residents, and motorists in and below the Cedar Creek burned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
